inscription: Side of the box: 貝線紋中次 Signed: 慎哉 {Shinya} with red seal 慎哉 {Shinya}; Side of the box lid: 夜光
text: The lacquer artist Yamamura Shinya inlaid thin, overlapping strips of turban shell to create a kaleidoscopic stripe motif. To a lesser extent, inlays of mother-of-pearl or abalone shell are common on Japanese lacquer either as an applique (haritsuke), or digging into the substrate to create a hollowed out spot (umekomi). The lid of this tea caddy is decorated with a technique known as gyōbu-hirame which has a scale-like pattern of gold foil over a nashiji ground (lit. pear-skin ground) of finer gold flakes. A nashiji ground is found on the inside and bottom, completing the lavish decoration.
title: Tea container with pattern of shell stripes "Nocturnal Luminescence"
